means: （为购买某物或做某事而）支付

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这组动词均含有"给予，赠给"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: give, accord, award, confer，grant, endow, present, bestow
means: give ： 最普通用词，泛指将自己的东西给予他人，所给予的东西，物质或非物质的均可。
accord ： 侧重所给予的是应得的或是恰当的，或是因某种原因而适于接受的。
award ： 通常暗示所给予的东西是接受者应得的，而且给予者往往是具有裁判权力的。
confer ： 通常指授予称号或学位等。
grant ： 多指出于慷慨、怜悯或正义感而给予，并且通常是在被请求下给予。
endow ： 指捐赠大量的钱作基金，也可指给予非物质的东西。
present ： 指正式地给予或授予，通常伴有仪式进行。
bestow ： 正式用词，指把某物作为礼物赠送于某人，也可作引申用。

sentence.Network_en: When life gets hard and you want to give up, remember that life is full of ups and downs, and without the downs, the ups would mean nothing.
sentence.Network_cn: 当生活很艰难，你想要放弃的时候，请记住，生活充满了起起落落，如果没有低谷，那站在高处也失去了意义。

sentence.Network_en: "I can't give you an answer now," he hedged.
sentence.Network_cn: “我现在不能回答你，”他闪避道。

sentence.Network_en: Give the cardboard two or three coats of varnish to harden it.
sentence.Network_cn: 在纸板上涂两三层清漆使其变硬。

phrase.cizu_name: give as good as one gets

jx.jx_en_mean: respond with equal force or vehemence when attacked
inadvertently reveal something secret or concealed
jx.jx_cn_mean: （无意中）泄露秘密（或暴露隐情）
我宁愿要（或更喜欢）；我想要（或喜欢）

lj.lj_ly: give me the mainland any day!.

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)used to express exasperation, protest, or disbelief
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)别烦我（表示恼怒、抗议或不信）

jx.jx_en_mean: (Brit. vulgar slang)(of a man) have sexual intercourse with a woman
(informal)to within — (used to express the degree or accuracy of a figure)
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)［用于表示某一数字的准确程度］相差不会超过…，出入至多…

lj.lj_ly: three hundred and fifty years ago, give or take a few.
lj.lj_ls: 350年前，估计相差至多只有几年。

phrase.cizu_name: give someone to understand (或 believe 或 know)

jx.jx_en_mean: inform someone in a formal and rather indirect way

lj.lj_ly: I was given to understand that I had been invited.

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal, chiefly Brit.)punish or scold someone severely
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式，主英)（严厉）惩罚（或斥责）某人

jx.jx_en_mean: (或 hoot 等)(informal)not care at all

lj.lj_ly: people who don't give a damn about the environment.

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)what's the news?; what's happening? (frequently used as a friendly greeting)
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)有什么消息吗？近来怎么样啊？（常用作招呼语）

jx.jx_en_mean: reveal the true identity of someone

lj.lj_ly: his strangely shaped feet gave him away.
lj.lj_ls: 他那双形状奇特的脚暴露了他的身份。

jx.jx_en_mean: hand over a bride ceremonially to her bridegroom as part of a wedding ceremony
jx.jx_cn_mean: 将新娘托付给新郎（婚礼的一个部分）

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English giefan, gefan, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch geven and German geben

collins.tran: 与表示动作的名词连用

entry.tran: （与表示身体动作的名词连用，表示该动作）
entry.def: You can use give with nouns that refer to physical actions. The whole expression refers to the performing of the action. For example, She gave a smile means almost the same as 'She smiled'.

example.ex: She stretched her arms out and gave a great yawn...
example.tran: 她伸了个懒腰，打了个大哈欠。

example.ex: Giving a sigh, she fell to her knees at my feet...
example.tran: 她叹了一口气，跪倒在我脚边。

entry.def: You use give to say that a person does something for another person. For example, if you give someone a lift, you take them somewhere in your car.

example.ex: I gave her a lift back out to her house...
example.tran: 我让她搭我的便车回家。

example.ex: He was given mouth-to-mouth resuscitation...
example.tran: 对他进行了口对口的人工呼吸。

entry.tran: （与表示信息、意见、问候等的名词连用）提供，给出，传递，告诉
entry.def: You use give with nouns that refer to information, opinions, or greetings to indicate that something is communicated. For example, if you give someone some news, you tell it to them.

example.ex: He gave no details...
example.tran: 他未透露细节。

example.ex: Would you like to give me your name?...
example.tran: 我能知道您的姓名吗？

entry.def: You use give to say how long you think something will last or how much you think something will be.

example.ex: A BBC poll gave the Labour Party a 12 per cent lead...
example.tran: 英国广播公司的一项民意调查预计工党将领先12个百分点。

example.ex: Ted and his lawyers gave the company 11 months to sell off everything.
example.tran: 特德和他的律师们预计这家公司在11个月的时间内将变卖所有东西。

entry.def: People use give in expressions such as I don't give a damn to show that they do not care about something.

example.ex: They don't give a damn about the country.
example.tran: 他们对这个国家毫不关心。

entry.tran: 使产生（某种想法或印象）
entry.def: If someone or something gives you a particular idea or impression, it causes you to have that idea or impression.

example.ex: They gave me the impression that they were doing exactly what they wanted in life...
example.tran: 他们给我的印象是，他们正在做自己人生中想做的事情。

example.ex: The examiner's final report does not give an accurate picture.
example.tran: 这位核查员的最终报告没有准确反映事实。

entry.tran: 使身体感到…；使产生（某种情绪）
entry.def: If someone or something gives you a particular physical or emotional feeling, it makes you experience it.

example.ex: He gave me a shock...
example.tran: 他使我大吃一惊。

example.ex: It will give great pleasure to the many thousands of children who visit the hospital each year.
example.tran: 这将为每年成千上万来医院求诊的儿童带来很大快乐。

entry.def: If you give a performance or speech, you perform or speak in public.

example.ex: Kotto gives a stupendous performance...
example.tran: 科托的表演令人惊叹。

example.ex: I am sure you remember Mrs Butler who gave us such an interesting talk last year.
example.tran: 我相信你一定还记得巴特勒夫人，去年她给我们作了一次非常有意思的演讲。

entry.def: If you give something thought or attention, you think about it, concentrate on it, or deal with it.

example.ex: I've been giving it some thought...
example.tran: 这件事我已经考虑了一阵子。

example.ex: Priority will be given to those who apply early.
example.tran: 早申请者将获优先考虑。

entry.def: If you give a party or other social event, you organize it.

example.ex: That evening, I gave a dinner party for a few close friends.
example.tran: 那天晚上，我设宴招待几位好朋友。

entry.def: If you give someone something that you own or have bought, you provide them with it, so that they have it or can use it.

example.ex: They gave us T-shirts and stickers...
example.tran: 他们为我们提供了T恤衫和贴纸。

example.ex: He gave money to the World Health Organisation to help defeat smallpox...
example.tran: 他向世界卫生组织提供资金以帮助消灭天花。

entry.def: If you give someone something that you are holding or that is near you, you pass it to them, so that they are then holding it.

example.ex: Give me that pencil...
example.tran: 把那支铅笔递给我。

example.ex: He pulled a handkerchief from his pocket and gave it to him.
example.tran: 他从口袋里掏出手绢递给他。

entry.def: To give someone or something a particular power or right means to allow them to have it.

example.ex: ...a citizen's charter giving rights to gays...
example.tran: 赋予同性恋者权利的公民宪章

example.ex: The draft would give the president the power to appoint the central bank's chairman.
example.tran: 该草案将授权总统任命中央银行行长。

collins.item: OTHER USES, PHRASES, AND PHRASAL VERBS
collins.tran: 其他用法，词组和动词短语

entry.def: If something gives, it collapses or breaks under pressure.

example.ex: My knees gave under me.
example.tran: 我两腿发软。

entry.def: You say that you are given to understand or believe that something is the case when you do not want to say how you found out about it, or who told you.

example.ex: We were given to understand that he was ill...
example.tran: 我们得知他病了。

example.ex: He has been given to believe that there may be a future for him and Maria together.
example.tran: 他于是相信他和玛丽亚也许还有希望在一起。

entry.tran: 毫不示弱地反击（或反驳）；回敬；以牙还牙
entry.def: If someone gives as good as they get, they fight or argue as well as the person they are fighting or arguing with.

example.ex: For the first time in 12 years, the Democrats are giving as good as they get.
example.tran: 民主党人12年来首次予以反击。

entry.tran: 愿意付出一切（强调十分渴望做某事或拥有某物）
entry.def: You use give in phrases such as I'd give anything ,I'd give my right arm, and what wouldn't I give to emphasize that you are very eager to do or have something.

example.ex: I'd give anything to be like you.
example.tran: 我真希望能像你一样。

entry.tran: 我宁可要；我宁可选择；我更喜欢
entry.def: You use give me to say that you would rather have one thing than another, especially when you have just mentioned the thing that you do not want.

example.ex: I've never had anything barbecued and I don't want it. Give me a good roast dinner any day.
example.tran: 我还从未吃过烧烤，也不想吃，我宁愿哪一天美美地吃一顿烘烤大餐。

entry.def: If you say that something requires give and take, you mean that people must compromise or co-operate for it to be successful.

example.ex: ...a happy relationship where there's  a lot of give and take.
example.tran: 经常互相体谅的美满爱情

entry.def: Give or take is used to indicate that  an amount is approximate. For example, if you say that something is fifty years old, give or take a few years, you mean that it is approximately fifty years old.

example.ex: They grow to a height of 12 ins —  give or take a couple of inches.
example.tran: 它们会长到12英寸高——出入至多几英寸。

entry.def: You say  I'll give you that to indicate that you admit that someone has a particular characteristic or ability.

example.ex: You're a bright enough kid, I'll give you that.
example.tran: 我得承认，你是个挺聪明的孩子。

entry.def: If an audience is asked to give it up for a performer, they are being asked to applaud.

example.ex: Ladies and Gentlemen, give it up for Fred Durst.
example.tran: 女士们，先生们，请为弗雷德·德斯特来点掌声。

means.word_mean: 1. the elasticity of something that can be stretched and returns to its original length
1. cause to have, in the abstract sense or physical sense;
2. be the cause or source of;

sentences.sentence: "He gave me a lot of trouble"

means.word_mean: 3. transfer possession of something concrete or abstract to somebody;

sentences.sentence: "She gave the children lots of love and tender loving care"

means.word_mean: 5. convey, as of a compliment, regards, attention, etc.; bestow;
7. convey or communicate; of a smile, a look, a physical gesture;
8. give as a present; make a gift of;

sentences.sentence: "What will you give her for her birthday?"
"His two singles gave the team the victory"
"The cow brings in 5 liters of milk"
"This year's crop yielded 1,000 bushels of corn"
"The estate renders some revenue for the family"
"Can I give you my keys while I go in the pool?"
"Can I give you the children for the weekend?"
"He gave his life for his children"
"I gave two sons to the war"

means.word_mean: 17. place into the hands or custody of;

sentences.sentence: "Turn the files over to me, please"
"He turned over the prisoner to his lawyers"

means.word_mean: 18. give entirely to a specific person, activity, or cause;

sentences.sentence: "She committed herself to the work of God"
"give one's talents to a good cause"
"I gave him a punch in the nose"

means.word_mean: 23. move in order to make room for someone for something;

sentences.sentence: "The park gave way to a supermarket"
"don't give the child this tough meat"
"The roof finally gave under the weight of the ice"

means.word_mean: 27. estimate the duration or outcome of something;

sentences.sentence: "He gave the patient three months to live"
"I gave him a very good chance at success"
"I'll give you three books for four CDs"
"The French doors give onto a terrace"
"Pollini is giving another concert in New York"

means.word_mean: 33. be flexible under stress of physical force;

sentences.sentence: "He gave the first of many toasts at the birthday party"
"This student gives promise of real creativity"

means.word_mean: 38. submit for consideration, judgment, or use;
39. guide or direct, as by behavior of persuasion;

sentences.sentence: "You gave me to think that you agreed with me"
"I give you two minutes to respond"
"She gave the boy a good spanking"

means.word_mean: 43. consent to engage in sexual intercourse with a man;

sentences.sentence: "She gave her hand to her little sister"

list.explanation: 呼唤(某人)，向(某人)打招呼或行礼

example.en: An old friend gave me a blow from the other side of the street.
example.zh: 一位老朋友在街道对面朝我打招呼。

list.explanation: 向(某人)表示祝贺或欢迎

example.en: John put out his hand for me to give me five.
example.zh: 约翰向我伸出手来表示祝贺。

list.explanation: 助(某人)一臂之力，帮(某人)忙

example.en: Hey，give that guy five over here for a minute, will ya?
example.zh: 喂，你到这边来帮那个家伙一下，好吗？

example.en: The boss really gave Wally the shaft.
example.zh: 老板确实是欺骗了书利。

example.en: Somebody always gives me the shaft.
She gave him the shaft after he broke their date last weekend.
example.zh: 他上周末失约后, 她就跟他吹了。

auth_sentence.content: Only the bright red comb is the give away.
auth_sentence.res_content: Only the bright red comb is the give away.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Only the bright red comb is the give away.

auth_sentence.content: This can give the music rather a mannered feel.
auth_sentence.res_content: This can give the music rather a mannered feel.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This can give the music rather a mannered feel.

auth_sentence.content: Give the team talk of your life King Vlad.
auth_sentence.res_content: Give the team talk of your life King Vlad.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Give the team talk of your life King Vlad.

sentences.en: The play gives us some new ideas.
sentences.cn: 这个剧本为我们提供了一些新的观念。

sentences.en: Give your money to the hotel manager to be looked after.
sentences.cn: 把你的钱交给旅馆经理保管。

sentences.en: A foreign guest is giving a lecture in English this afternoon.
sentences.cn: 一位外宾今天下午要来作英语演讲。

sentences.en: The following evening a party was given for him by his parents.
sentences.cn: 第二天晚上他父母为他举行了一个派对。

sentences.en: The sun gives the earth light and warmth.
sentences.cn: 太阳使地球得到光和热。

sentences.en: They gave me to believe they were coming.
sentences.cn: 他们让我相信他们会来。

jushi.english: Most people give to some charity at Christmas.
jushi.chinese: 圣诞节时大多数人向慈善机构捐款。

jushi.english: He wasn't the cleverest member of the committee, but he always gave of his best—a hard worker with sincere intentions.
jushi.chinese: 他在委员会中不算最聪明,但他总是尽力做好工作,是一个诚实苦干的人。

jushi.english: He gives freely to the poor.
